intro: Alchemilla glaberrima var. fallax, commonly known as the fallax alkanet, is a perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its basal rosette of broad, silver-green leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in early summer, typically clustered in loose inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained, rocky or gravelly soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental foliage and low maintenance requirements, it is often cultivated in gardens and rockeries.
